intro: Bistorta petiolata, commonly known as the petioled bistorta, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright, reddish stems and large, heart-shaped leaves with a rough, textured surface. Its flowers are small and clustered in dense, cylindrical inflorescences, typically blooming in late summer. Bistorta petiolata is often found in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
